The animations\, graphics\, and gameplay were all world class when the game came out but it was the memorable musical score\, characters\, and authentic emotional yet grounded storytelling that made the game world class for me. Part II on the other hand just feels like a game that’s lost. On a technical level the work on display is phenomenal. The graphics are unreal\, the animation work and AI is often next level\, but the most important area\, the characters and story is where things fall so short. Where as in the first game every character genuinely felt like they had purpose and an individual arc which added to overall arc between Ellie & Joel\, the characters in Part II didn’t connect & were often forgetful. The events that take place and actions taken by the characters also felt painfully contrived and awkward with none of the payoff the first game gave. By the later parts of the game I just wanted it to be over as it kept dragging on to its unsatisfying end. I’ve heard others say that it’s subverting your expectations and wants to express nihilism\, but it all just comes off as incompetent writing. Overall after loving the first game to death Part II just falls so flat.… Expand
